title: Mushroom Pork Chops Recipe
description: These pork chops with cream of mushroom soup, chopped onions, garlic, and fresh mushrooms are deliciously savory, comforting, and easy to make.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Main Dishes Pork Pork Chop Recipes Braised Mushroom Pork Chops 4.5 (2,217) 1,519 Reviews 136 Photos These pork chops with cream of mushroom soup are quick and easy, but very delicious. This is one of my family's favorite dinners served with brown rice. Submitted by mmcgee Updated on December 2, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 136 136 136 136 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 pork chops salt and ground black pepper to taste 1 pinch garlic salt, or to taste ½ pound fresh mushrooms, sliced 1 onion, chopped 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Brown chops on both sides over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet; transfer browned chops to a plate. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add mushrooms and onion to the same skillet and sauté for one minute. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange browned chops on top of mushroom mixture. Pour soup over chops. Cover, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until chops are cooked through and no longer pink in the center, 20 to 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,931 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 210 Calories 9g Fat 10g Carbs 24g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 210 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 11% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Cholesterol 65mg 22% Sodium 924mg 40% Total Carbohydrate 10g 3% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 3g Protein 24g 47% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 29mg 2% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 600mg 13% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Mushroom Pork Chops 01 of 136 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 136 Photo by  Cameron Mathies 11/22/2024 03 of 136 Photo by  Mary Lou Creamer 06/18/2023 I loved that this recipe was so easy and required so few ingredients. However, I am so glad I read the reviews before making this. I opted to follow the suggestion of another member who added a half-cup of dry white wine and rosemary. Served in on long grain wild rice with green beans, and it was perfect! Even my weimaraner liked and he can be a food snob! This will definately be on my table again! 04 of 136 Photo by  Tabatha Meredith 01/19/2023 It's a good start. I did not use cream of mushroom. I used 1, 13.5 oz can of coconut milk. I added a small tsp. Of lemon grass paste. Worcestershire sauce to taste, for me about 5 tablespoons. I used yellow sweet onion and regular white mushrooms bc it's what I had. Would rather portobello. I added baby spinach at the end. I served over a white, brown, wild, and red rice mixture. 05 of 136 Photo by  Sarah Hipolito 03/22/2022 Made it with mashed potatoes, great pairing! 06 of 136 Photo by  FeistyMint2845 03/17/2022 I forgot to take pic of plate … but this was a great dish, husband and I enjoyed it with some mashed potatoes and some steamed mixed vegetables 07 of 136 Photo by  Malissa R. 12/18/2021 It was my first and definitely not my last time making this! Delicious! 08 of 136 Photo by  Malissa R. 12/18/2021 It was my first and definitely not my last time making this! Delicious! 09 of 136 Photo by  jessyka0118 10/25/2021 This came out absolutely delicious I put it over cauliflower rice perfect meal! ?? 10 of 136 Photo by  Holly Carr 07/28/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Fennel Pork Chops 58 Ratings Smothered Pork Chops 273 Ratings Pleasant Pork Chops 739 Ratings Sage Pork Chops 1,308 Ratings Amazing Pork Chops in Cream Sauce 288 Ratings Air Fryer Ranch Pork Chops 49 Ratings Tomato-Smothered Pork Chops 77 Ratings Grandma's Pork Chops in Mushroom Gravy 285 Ratings Grandmother's Pork Chop Dinner 92 Ratings Horseradish Pork Chops 124 Ratings Apple Pork Chops 515 Ratings Tomato Pork Loin Chops 287 Ratings Pork Chops with Mushroom Onion Gravy 100 Ratings My Favorite Pork Chops 538 Ratings Rosemary and Garlic Simmered Pork Chops 129 Ratings Tomato Chops I 29 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
